TopicTitle: Can somene ge to me mun rocket with lander

Articles.Content:
I already built a rocket that orbited around the moon and back

I can not build a rocket that would be capable of landing on the moon.

I wonder if someone has already built a rocket with a lander that would remind NASA projects.

Design of the rocket and its pilot are completely two different things

I managed to build several projects with the lander rocket, but unfortunately they are all too heavy and either explode at launch site or shortly after launch. Now I begin to regret that I bought this game but only a little:)

It's not fun if you didn't build the rocket. Trust me, it's worth the hard work and huge explosions for that feeling when you land on the Mun for the first time. That incredible sense of achievement. I'm not one to describe it, so you'll just have to trust me. It's spectacular.

x

Edited May 15, 2018 by zgubilembulke

Not posting a rocket but here are some tips of how I build rockets which can land.

I'll start with one man lander.

Lander must be small with one or 1&1/2 fuel tanks with 4 legs. The purpose of a light lander is to make it easy to maneuver and it significantly reduces the previous stages sizes if it's light.

Orbit + transfer stage should use a powerful engine and have 2 fuel tanks.

Accent stage needs lots of thrust and should get you to the upper atmosphere at at least 1100m/s. I would use two large fuel tanks and a large engine.

Finally add lost of boosters to get your accent stage out off the thick atmosphere.
SNapple is right. Just keep at it and eventually you will get it. It's quite a good feeling when you finally make it to the MÃƒÂ¼n with a rocket you built yourself.

If you wish to find rockets you have posted in the right section just browse posts and find.one you like.

My Sig contains a few crafts and this section of the forum is full of many more so happy hunting or building whichever you decide.
CTRL+SHIFT+ALT+D to have some cheats or whatever. Only use for last resort.
